image.altText: An aerial view of the orchestra playing.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Symphony Orchestra warns it could one day not have enough musicians to perform if proposed changes to the Australian National University go ahead, while prospective students say they're now considering studying interstate.

title.children: 'Our concerns have risen': Orchestra says it could fold due to ANU cuts

image.altText: A man walks our of a building, he is looking down and wearing a suit and a face mask.

props.synopsis: A jury sees a police interview with one of the two alleged victims of a former Canberra childcare worker accused of acts of indecency, in which the three-year-old said the man touched her "a lot".

title.children: Former childcare worker on trial for indecency against children in his care

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flag.

props.synopsis: A suspended protective services officer is given a two-year good behaviour order after sending CCTV images of himself being allegedly assaulted in a Canberra police watch house to a family member.

title.children: Protective services officer who shared protected material told to 'reassess' future

image.altText: Two Australian $100 bills, the top being genuine and the bottom a counterfeit that reads "copy" in the top right corner.

props.synopsis: Genuine Australian bank notes have security features like hidden images and fluorescent ink, and return to shape after being scrunched.

title.children: Counterfeit cash is circulating in Canberra. Here's how to spot a fake note

image.altText: Ethan Strange of the Raiders celebrates scoring a try during the round 23 NRL match between Canberra Raiders and Manly Sea Eagles at GIO Stadium, on August 08, 2025, in Canberra, Australia.

props.synopsis: At 21 and on the back of a breakout season, Ethan Strange has the ball on a string, Canberra's finals fate in his hands and the rugby league world at his feet.

title.children: How the youngest of a new generation helped build Canberra's brave new world

image.altText: Ornate snake door handles next to sign 'Fun Time Pony'.

props.synopsis: Patrons at a Canberra nightclub experience breathing difficulties along with eye and skin irritation after a woman allegedly releases capsicum spray inside the venue.

title.children: Nightclub evacuated after woman allegedly releases capsicum spray

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair leans on an iron fence next to a highway with a large truck driving on it.

props.synopsis: Murrumbateman residents express significant safety concerns about the Barton Highway and repeated calls for it to be duplicated after another fatality on the road this week.

title.children: Daughter still campaigning for same highway duplication her father called for

image.altText: albanese roundtable

props.synopsis: The economic reform roundtable discusses the prospect of streamlining skills recognition for qualified migrants. Follow live.

title.children: Roundtable discusses streamlining skills recognition for migrants

image.altText: A young girl sitting in a sandy alcove

props.synopsis: A court hears the prosecution is preparing a 155-exhibit brief against Tanika Bromley and James Wood, including DNA testing, a ballistics report and material from "multiple crime scenes".

title.children: Police compiling huge brief against Pheobe Bishop's alleged killers

image.altText: Tourists taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: Spain could soon overtake France as the most visited country in the world and locals have had enough.

title.children: 'Go home': Country everyone wants to visit is turning on tourists

image.altText: A composite image of Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter facing each other in parliament.

props.synopsis: A no-confidence motion in Tasmania's Liberal government has failed to pass, signalling the final note in the snap Tasmanian election a month ago. Follow live.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals retain power as no-confidence motion defeated

image.altText: An elderly man standing with a walking stick in a black and white striped shirt and a grey hat

props.synopsis: The six men — aged between 80 and 96 — served decades in prison while refusing to renounce their communist beliefs and include a 95-year-old who was arrested during the Korean War.

title.children: Six elderly spies ask to be sent home to North Korea

image.altText: David Sevelle prays with a Thai monk behind him

props.synopsis: New Zealand's financial watchdog has issued a warning about an embattled internet scheme founded by an Australian with a colourful past.

title.children: NZ authorities' warning over Aussie's controversial 'ethical' internet

image.altText: A white page with red border, red and grey iinet, connect better logo, house logo with residential underneath, skyscraper.

props.synopsis: A list of about 280,000 active email addresses and roughly 20,000 active landline phone numbers have been extracted from iiNet's order management system.

title.children: Cyber attack exposes details of more than 200,000 iinet customers

image.altText: A close-up side profile of a man with thick brown hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: The trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright has heard from four more witnesses, with family members of injured pilot Sebastian Robinson among those who gave evidence.

title.children: Jury hears Matt Wright told pilot to 'delete, delete, delete' items from phone — as it happened

image.altText: A man smiles at a camera while at a hospital. He sits in a chair and has a canula in his arm.

props.synopsis: A few months ago, Bugs bassist Jordan Brunoli was diagnosed with "incurable" stage 4 colorectal cancer. Now he and his band mates are warning other young people about the symptoms to watch for.

title.children: A 29-year-old Triple J star has 'incurable' colorectal cancer. What are the symptoms?

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja in a dark room looking at a man in a business suit

props.synopsis: The findings from South Australia's landmark Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence have been released nine months after the first public hearings were held, and amid expectations of sweeping changes to address abuse.

title.children: 'Lead with courage' DV royal commissioner urges, as findings released

image.altText: Building with police tape.

props.synopsis: The police Ethical Standards Command is investigating the death of a man at a childcare centre on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Six children hidden as man smashed way into childcare centre

image.altText: Malakai stands in his wet suit next to a canal at Mooloolaba.

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old travelled from Golden Beach to Noosa on an electric hydrofoil board, breaking the distance record by 20 kilometres.

title.children: Queensland teenager cruises to unofficial world record with ocean adventure

image.altText: a baby in bandages

props.synopsis: In August last year, a stranger allegedly threw a thermos of hot coffee on the nine-month-old baby, in what police described as a "savage attack".

title.children: Mother of baby burned in 'savage' coffee attack makes plea for justice

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A Victorian government department wants to keep secret how it manages the life of a vulnerable teenage girl, who remains locked up after stabbing a woman to death in 2023.

title.children: Department that 'failed' teenage killer makes secrecy bid over her ongoing care

image.altText: People hold umbrellas in cold wet windy weather

props.synopsis: Sydney's wettest August in nearly 30 years has tipped the city's recent climate into uncharted territory.

title.children: Sydney records most rain since weather station opened in 1858

image.altText: Alex de Minaur of Australia and Katie Boulter of Great Britain during the Mixed Doubles second-round match during Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's quest to play doubles at the US Open is rejected, as Nick Kyrgios pulls out of the newly formatted draw.

title.children: De Minaur rejected for new US Open doubles format as Kyrgios pulls out

image.altText: Two serious young men, sit on window of grey metal building, one holds the other, white dog, black markings, plants.

props.synopsis: Josh Heins and Manu Bohn believe their tiny home on wheels does not need approval, but their local council does not agree.

title.children: Couple faces eviction amid calls for clarity on laws for tiny homes

image.altText: a man with brown hair and glasses in a blue checked shirt

props.synopsis: Artificial eye maker Jack McDonald has been ordered to stop operating while the Health Complaints Commissioner in Victoria continues an investigation into him.

title.children: Artificial eye maker ordered to stop working while investigation underway

image.altText: The facade of a real estate agency building sits on a streetscape.

props.synopsis: A Victorian real estate agency escapes a hefty fine and conviction after an "honest" mistake resulted in a rental property being listed without a fixed price.

title.children: Agency escapes fine for 'honest' mistake when pricing rental property

image.altText: WA Chief Justice Peter Quinlan speaks to ABC WA State Political Reporter Keane Bourke

props.synopsis: WA's chief justice says everyone should be worried about the rise of 'sovereign citizens' who do not believe in the law, warning of the risks to "the safety and stability" of society.

title.children: WA's top judge issues warning over rise of 'sovereign citizens'

image.altText: A Vietnam War veteran stands smiling in front of the Vietnam Memorial Walk sign.

props.synopsis: An idea over a cup of coffee between two South Australian mates has turned into a grand event, with scores of veterans, a former ADF chief and a rock legend attending the opening.

title.children: Vietnam veteran once 'rejected' after war unveils new memorial walking trail

image.altText: a fossil of a pearl next to a scale showing its nearly 2cm wide

props.synopsis: An "incredibly valuable" prehistoric pearl slightly larger than a typical marble is verified as more than 100 million years old, after its discovery in north-west Queensland.

title.children: Tourist digs up 100-million-year-old pearl in the outback

image.altText: A car on fire in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are continuing to hunt for the gunman responsible for shooting a man dead and seriously wounding another, after a burnt-out luxury car was found in Sydney's north-west overnight.

title.children: Police examining burnt-out sports car possible link to Sydney pub shooting

image.altText: A man warms up with an AFL ball

props.synopsis: Adelaide veteran Taylor Walker says a verdict is expected to be handed down on Tuesday into an alleged homophobic slur made by teammate Izak Rankine as calls ramp up to stop discrimination in sport.

title.children: Teammate says Rankine 'remorseful', as Crows await AFL investigation findings

image.altText: A woman holding a stack of fluffy blankets and cushions.

props.synopsis: While the health effects of inhaling and consuming microplastics are not yet fully known, we asked a microplastics researcher how they minimise contact with them.

title.children: Want to reduce microplastics in your home? Here's where to start

image.altText: A hole in the ground in the shape of a thin rectangle, with a group of people standing around it

props.synopsis: The Assad family's rule was among the most brutal in the region and its prison system, including feared sites such as Saydnaya, was notorious for disappearing people without a trace.

title.children: Over 300,000 Syrians may have gone missing during Assad regime

image.altText: Grey smoke billows into the clear sky as multiple destroyed buildings are struck

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has accepted a new proposal from Arab mediators for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip as Israel indicates its stance on the war has not changed.

title.children: Hamas accepts Arab ceasefire proposal, Palestinian death toll passes 62,000

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of Megan Washington, a woman in her late 30s, with Paul Kelly, 70, his arm around her.

props.synopsis: With her first record of original music since leaving a major label, Gem, Meg Washington has approached songwriting from a fresh perspective, where she sings about what feels good.

title.children: On the cusp of 40, Meg Washington is re-considering why she makes music
